dublin_core.dcvalue: Forty one patients suffering from type 2 diabetes mellitus were selected to receive diabetes education at a local health centre via low cost videoconferencing equipment The educational material was transmitted from the diabetic centre of a district hospital Four educational sessions were carried out over 4 5 months Satisfaction was measured using a self administered questionnaire on the completion of the programme Of the 41 subjects who participated in the study 36 88 completed the questionnaire Patients reported a high level of satisfaction with most aspects of the education process The mean total score on the questionnaire was 61 9 SD 9 4 the highest possible total score was 75 There was a significant positive correlation between age and satisfaction level r 0 39 The results showed that diabetes education conducted via telemedicine was highly acceptable to diabetic patients
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:57:57Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2002-01-25
Patient satisfaction with telediabetes education in Hong Kong.
